conclusion: Analyze the electric field in the capacitor before and after the metal plate is removed to determine the force on particle P.
Electric field E between two parallel plates is E = V/d.
Consider the distance l as part of the capacitor configuration when the metal plate is removed.
Electrostatic force on particle P is Fe = qE and is balanced by gravitational force Fg, so qE = mg.
After the metal plate is removed, the new electric field E' is E' = V/(d - l).
Electrostatic force on particle P after removal is F'e = qE'.
Change in force ΔF is ΔF = F'e - Fe = qV(l/d(d - l)).
Relate change in force to acceleration using ΔF = ma, resulting in a = qVl/md(d - l).
The acceleration of the particle's motion after the metal plate is removed is a = qVl/md(d - l).
